src:
首相、東アジア首脳会議へ…中国首相らとの個別会談も

03 Nov 2019, 12:24



バンコクに向けて昭恵夫人（右）とともに羽田空港を出発する安倍首相（３日午後）＝松本剛撮影

　【バンコク＝池田慶太】安倍首相は３日、政府専用機で羽田空港を出発し、タイのバンコクに到着した。４日には米中韓やＡＳＥＡＮ各国が参加する東アジア首脳会議などに出席する。中国の李克強（リークォーチャン）首相らとの個別会談も行う予定だ。
　首相は出発前、羽田空港で記者団に対し、中国が軍事拠点化を進める南シナ海問題について「法の支配に基づく、自由で開かれた海洋秩序を守るため、全ての当事者が力ではなく、国際法に基づいて紛争を平和的に解決することの重要性を強く訴えたい」と述べた。
　日中韓やＡＳＥＡＮなど１６か国による東アジア地域包括的経済連携（ＲＣＥＰ）交渉に関しては、「まだ課題は残されているが、太平洋からインド洋へと広がる広大な地域に、自由で公正なルールに基づく経済圏を作り上げるために、日本は交渉を引っ張っていきたい」と意欲を示した。
　政府専用機内では出発後の３日午後３時頃、調理用のオーブンで耐熱袋入りのパンを温めていたところ、焦げ臭くなり煙が出たため消火器を使った。機内は乗務員が対応に追われるなど一時騒然となったが、けが人はなく、運航に影響はなかった。機内放送では「ぼや」とアナウンスされたが、防衛省は「火は確認していなかった」としている。
　機体は米ボーイング７７７―３００ＥＲ型機。今年４月に運用を始め、航空自衛隊が運航している。
text:
Prime Minister to the East Asia Summit ... Individual talks with Chinese Prime Ministers

03 Nov 2019, 12:24



Photographed by Prime Minister Abe (afternoon on the 3rd) departed from Haneda Airport with Mrs. Akie (right) towards Bangkok

[Bangkok = Keita Ikeda] Prime Minister Abe left Haneda Airport on the 3rd with a government-only machine and arrived in Bangkok, Thailand. On the 4th, he will attend the East Asia Summit where US, China, South Korea and ASEAN countries participate. A separate meeting with Chinese Prime Minister Lee Kwok-Chan will also be held.
Before departure, the Prime Minister told reporters at Haneda Airport about the South China Sea issue that China is becoming a military base: “To protect a free and open maritime order based on the rule of law, I would like to urge the importance of peacefully resolving conflicts based on the law. "
Regarding the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) negotiations by 16 countries such as Japan, China and South Korea and ASEAN, “There are still challenges, but it is free and fair in a vast area extending from the Pacific Ocean to the Indian Ocean. In order to build a rule-based economic zone, Japan wants to pull negotiations. "
In the government plane, around 3 pm on the third day after departure, when the pan with the heat-resistant bag was heated in a cooking oven, it became burnt and smoke was emitted, so a fire extinguisher was used. The cabin was temporarily noisy as the crew was busy responding, but there were no injuries and there was no impact on the flight. The in-flight broadcast was announced as “Boya”, but the Ministry of Defense said that “Fire was not confirmed”.
The aircraft is a US Boeing 777-300ER. It began operation in April this year and is operated by the Air Self Defense Force.
